author: @Chr.Skagvard
text:
The worst part about listening to things from Marxists is that multi-tasking becomes difficult because the words spoken actually mean something. Always interesting to hear other people's thoughts., contemplated the modern day idiocracy of capitalism this night, I go on adrenaline fueled taught argumenting against myself. 

There is no explanation for why we aren't just fixing things outside of the possibility that politicians and economics are idiots.Moving capitalism closer to feudalism is not beneficial to anyone, perhaps revolutionaries. They're sitting on the means of production that surpasses any earlier generations wildest dreams, there exists enough production capability to solve our current problems. But I guess the truth that Marx & Engels explained is the greed and ignorance of the rulings class so no matter how much wealth they accumulate there is no end in sight. 

MAYBE JUST MAYBE it's all a Chinese psyop; there is nothing that scares me more than that thought of no one steering the ship we are on.

author: @redpepper1968
text: The ACP should pay more attention to the trade unions the natural organisation of workers.  Take root in these organisations, struggle for immediate needs of the workers such as for higher wages and better working conditions, make the workers feel the power of organisation through small victories, and then raise their class consciousness in the process.

author: @PatrickMcKenna-c5d
text:
Great video guys. Basically, Carlos has nailed it. We have to get out there among the people and show what we're about, as well as just talking to them. 
Many people just want a home, a decent job, decent pay, and a better future for their children. 
And we need to show them that we don't just talk, we actively get out there and DO something.
Either that, or we end up just becoming an echo chamber that preaches to the converted.

author: @oldguard007
text:
The dialogue presents a rich ground for analysis through the lens of dialectical materialism. It reflects the ongoing contradictions within capitalist societies and the struggle of the proletariat to achieve class consciousness and revolutionary change.

The Role of the Communist Party:
The ACP's strategy to integrate into existing working-class communities rather than imposing external ideologies aligns with the materialist understanding that revolutionary potential arises from the material conditions and lived experiences of the proletariat. By engaging in community service and addressing immediate needs, the ACP is engaging in praxis that could elevate class consciousness.

Critique of the "Old Left":
The dialogue criticizes previous leftist movements for creating isolated communities and attempting to "invade" working-class spaces. This reflects a failure to understand the material conditions and consciousness of the proletariat. Revolutionary movements must emerge organically from the contradictions within the existing society, not be imposed from without.

Winning Through Deeds:
Emphasizing actions over rhetoric demonstrates an understanding that material conditions shape consciousness. By materially improving the lives of workers, the ACP is not only addressing immediate needs but also demonstrating the practical benefits of collective action and socialist principles.

Challenges from the Left and Right:
The ACP faces opposition from both liberal leftists and overt fascists. This is indicative of the dialectical tension inherent in capitalist societies, where the ruling class and its ideological apparatus seek to co-opt or suppress genuine revolutionary movements. The "controlled counter-hegemony" mentioned reflects how bourgeois society can absorb and neutralize dissenting ideas by promoting a harmless version of opposition.

State Repression:
Reports of state harassment underscore the role of the bourgeois state as an instrument of class oppression. The state's function is to maintain the conditions favorable to capital accumulation, and any threat to this order is met with repression. This aligns with the materialist understanding of the state as a tool of the ruling class.

The Role of Ideology and Culture:
The dialogue touches on how culture and ideology are used to pacify the masses, referencing the production of "garbage culture" and the co-optation of leftist movements. This reflects the superstructural elements of society that serve to reinforce the economic base, a key concept in historical materialism.

International Context:
The mention of global events, such as conflicts involving NATO and shifts in imperialist power dynamics, highlights the interconnectedness of capitalist crises worldwide. These global contradictions can exacerbate internal class struggles, providing both challenges and opportunities for revolutionary movements.

Emphasis on Courage and Character:
The ACP's focus on cultivating virtues like courage and honor among its members is essential for sustaining a revolutionary movement. The development of a proletarian ethos counters the alienation and individualism fostered by capitalist society.

Social Democracy and Fascism:
The analysis of social democracy as a moderate wing of fascism reflects a materialist critique of how reformist movements can inadvertently preserve the capitalist system by alleviating some of its contradictions without challenging its foundations. Fascism can arise as a reactionary force when the ruling class feels threatened, co-opting elements of nationalism and directing the frustrations of the proletariat away from revolutionary aims.

The Path Forward:
The ACP's approach of building trust within communities, demonstrating the practical benefits of socialism, and preparing for electoral participation at the local level represents a dialectical progression. By addressing immediate material needs while fostering class consciousness, they aim to transform both the material conditions and the ideological superstructure.

Conclusion:

From a dialectical materialist standpoint, the dialogue reflects the inherent contradictions of capitalism in the United States and the efforts of the proletariat to navigate these challenges. The ACP's strategies demonstrate an understanding of the importance of grounding revolutionary movements in the material conditions of the working class. By learning from past failures and adapting to current realities, they embody the dialectical process of thesis, antithesis, and synthesis, striving toward the eventual overthrow of capitalist relations and the establishment of a socialist society.

replies.author: @ulyanov17
replies.text: what do you mean by that? there is always a surplus to one's productive work. maybe outside the issue of service jobs - there shouldn't be a problem with life expenses

replies.author: @TheWickedWitchofSE
replies.text: @ulyanov17 The nuclear family caretakers produce only use value. A proletarian worker must produce surplus to be able to have immediate use value produced in the home. That said, I don't quite understand the person's comment as capitalism is what causes the first part of their statement and if they mean will it be reversed in a capitalist system, then the answer is of course not.

author: @hensteeth
text:
When all of our industries were being shipped out of the country, we were told that this was a good thing, and we should celebrate it. We would all have new, better, jobs that would require college education. And the hard, dirty jobs would be done by other people, in far away places.

I don't remember any voices pointing out the many serious flaws in those lies.

replies.author: @dcorgard
replies.text: That's because they didn't allow such voices to be heard. Now it's slightly more difficult with the internet being a place that (for now) one can reach more than those immediately around oneself.

author: @Daisy-yq1gi
text: They look like right wingers and fly the racist, Imperialist US flag. They claim some sort of historic link to Gus Hall's US Communist Party but none such exists. ACP is a social fascist movement. Horribly reactionary. How anyone who claims to support a Marxist group and support chauvinist and fascist ideas is beyond me.

replies.author: @british_partisan
replies.text: Can you back up a single one of these claims? How do they look right wing? How are they social-fascists, chauvinist etc? They are steadfastly anti-imperialist. They are anti-racist and explicitly oppose fascism. Their members are of many ethnicities. How are they reactionary? They uphold and celebrate historical tradition of revolution and Marxism-Leninism.
